Diagnosis
	1. Solid pseudopapillary neoplasm of pancreas

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy performed by Mr [redacted name]

	Radiotherapy
	Not indicated

	Chemotherapy
	Not indicated

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	No evidence of disease

	Current issues
	Post-operative recovery

	Summary of consultation
	This 28 year old lady was referred following incidental finding of a pancreatic mass on ultrasound performed for non-specific abdominal pain. CT pancreas confirmed a 3.2cm well-circumscribed mass in the tail of pancreas. She underwent successful distal pancreatectomy and splenectomy on 15/3/24.

Histology confirms a solid pseudopapillary neoplasm, completely excised with clear margins. Immunohistochemistry shows beta-catenin nuclear positivity. No lymphovascular invasion identified. Final staging pT1N0.

She has made an excellent post-operative recovery with no complications. Her wound has healed well and she reports good energy levels. She has commenced recommended post-splenectomy vaccinations.

On examination today, her surgical wound is well-healed. Abdomen is soft and non-tender. No concerning features.

	Further investigations
	None required at present

	Medication prescribed
	Prophylactic penicillin V 250mg BD

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 months with surveillance CT

	Required GP actions
	Please ensure completion of post-splenectomy vaccination schedule

	Summary of information given to the patient
	Excellent prognosis discussed. Explained importance of post-splenectomy precautions and vaccinations. Written information provided regarding solid pseudopapillary neoplasms.
